add.description: outputs the result of value 1 plus value 2. value 1 and value 2 are intended to be patch targets for modulators.

addcentered.description: outputs the result of value 1 plus value 2, multiplied by range 2. optimized for using to modulation value 1 by range 2 at a frequency. value 1 or value 2 are intended to be patch targets for modulators.

controls.octaves: how many octaves to step through
controls.step: direction and distance to step through arpeggiation. a value of zero is "pingpong".

arpeggiator.description: arpeggiates held notes. there are several vestigial features in this module that should be cleaned up.

controls.level: the input audio level. hook this up to an LED-display midi control to see the value displayed on your controller.

audiometer.description: sets a slider to an audio level's volume. useful to map a midi display value to.

audiorouter.description: selector for switching where audio is routed to. connect to targets to add them to the list.

audiotocv.description: use an audio signal to modulate a control. allow for audio-rate modulation, to achieve effects such as FM.

controls.release: the cooldown time for the audio signal before a pulse can be triggered again
controls.threshold: send a pulse when the signal hits this threshold

audiotopulse.description: sends a pulse when the audio level surpasses a specified threshold

autotalent.description: [abandoned module, possibly broken]autotune using the "autotalent" code

controls.bars*: how many measures long are the samples in this slot?
controls.double*: enable this to play at double speed
controls.filter*: layer filter. negative values bring in a low pass, positive values bring in a high pass.
controls.selector*: which sample should we play in this slot? drag samples onto here to add them to this slot.

beats.description: multi-loop player, for mixing sample layers together

bitcrush.description: reduce sample resolution and sample rate for lo-fi effects

controls.retrigger: immediately replay current notes when changing the capo amount

chorddisplayer.description: display which chord is playing, in the context of the current scale

controls.diatonic: should the grid be chromatic, or locked to the scale only?

chorder.description: takes an incoming pitch and plays additional notes to form chords

controls.pulse to play: when enabled, input notes aren't played immediately, but instead wait for an input pulse before playing

chordholder.description: keeps any notes pressed at the same time sustaining, until new notes are pressed

controls.length*: number of steps in this ring
controls.note*: pitch to use for this ring

circlesequencer.description: polyrhythmic sequencer that displays a loop as a circle

comment.description: a box to display some text, to explain a section of a patch

controls.lookahead: how much time to "look ahead" to adjust the compression envelope. this necessarily introduces a delay into your output, which could be compensated for by running sequencers slightly early.
controls.mix: amount of compression. lower this value for a "parallel compression" effect. you should use this mix slider instead of the effectchain's mix slider, to compensate for lookahead.
controls.ratio: how much gain reduction to apply when the single passes the threshold
controls.threshold: threshold where gain should start to be reduced

compressor.description: try to keep volume at a certain level

controlsequencer.description: modulate a control step-wise at an interval

controls.input: input value (intended as a modulation target)

curve.description: remap an input over its range with a curve. double-click on the curve to add points, right click on points to remove them, drag on lines to bend them.

curvelooper.description: modulate a value over time with a looping curve

dcoffset.description: add a constant offset to an audio signal

dcremover.description: high pass filter with a 10hz cutoff to remove DC offset, to keep signal from drifting away from zero

controls.dry: should the dry signal pass through, or just the delayed signal?
controls.feedback: should the output audio feed back into the delay?
controls.input: should we accept input into the delay?
controls.interval: sets delay length to a musical duration
controls.invert: should the delayed audio have its signal inverted? this can give a different sound, and also cancel out DC offset to prevent it from accumulating with feedback.
controls.short: shortcut to shrink the range of the delay slider, to allow for audible-rate delays and comb filter sounds

controls.center input: remove dc offset from input signal to distort in a more controlled way
controls.clip: cutoff point of distortion, lower values result in more extreme distortion
controls.fuzz: push input signal off-center to distort asymmetrically
controls.preamp: signal gain before feeding into distortion

controls.aud: scroll to audition samples in the current pad's head category, or a directory last dropped onto a pad
controls.envelope *: should we apply a volume envelope to the sample?
controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module
controls.hitcategory*: folder to choose from, when clicking the "random" button. these folders are found in the data/drums/hits/ directory
controls.linkid *: if linkid is not -1, silence any other sample with a matching linkid (useful for linking open and closed hats)
controls.random *: choose a random sample from the selected hitcategory
controls.repeat: if quantizing, should held notes repeat at that interval?
controls.shuffle: random is samples, speeds, and pans
controls.single out *: should the sample have its own individual output?
controls.widen *: stereo delay of sample to create width

drumplayer.description: sample player intended for drum playback

controls.<: shift whole pattern one step earlier
controls.>: shift whole pattern one step later
controls.column: current column, to use for visualizing the step on a midi controller
controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module
controls.measures: length of the sequence in measures
controls.metastep: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module to control the "meta step". I forget what this does. oops.
controls.offset*: shift row forward/backward in time. try making your snares a little early, your hats a little late, etc.
controls.r amt: the chance that each step will change when being randomized. low values will only change a small amount of the sequence, high values will replace more of the sequence.
controls.r den: density of the randomizer output. the higher this is, the busier the random output will be.
controls.repeat: repeat input notes at this rate
controls.str: velocity to use when setting a step via a grid controller, if the checkbox next to this slider is checked
controls.use str: if the "str" slider should be used for setting velocity
controls.velocity: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module to control the velocity
controls.yoff: vertical offset for grid controller's view of the pattern

drumsequencer.description: step sequencer intended for drums. hold shift when dragging on the grid to adjust step velocity.

controls.<: move this effect to earlier in the chain
controls.>: move this effect to later in the chain
controls.exit effect: on push2, back effect control out to the main effectchain controls

effectchain.description: container to hold a list of effects, applied in series. the effects can be easily reordered with the < and > buttons, and deleted with the x button. hold shift to expose a x button for all effects.

controls.advanced: switch to advanced envelope editor (allows for a more complicated envelope than just an ADSR). double-click on an advanced envelope line to add stages, right click on points to remove them, drag on lines to bend them.
controls.has sustain: should this envelope have a sustain stage?
controls.max sustain: what's the maximum length of the sustain, in milliseconds? a value of -1 indicates no maximum
controls.sustain stage: which step of the envelope should have the sustain?
controls.use velocity: should envelope output be scaled by input velocity?

envelope.description: modulate a value with a triggered envelope

controls.type*: what type of filter should this band use

eq.description: multi-band equalizer, to adjust output levels at frequency ranges

controls.canvas:
canvas of events. canvas controls:
-shift-click to add an event
-hold shift and drag an event to duplicate
-hold alt to drag an event without snapping
-hold ctrl while dragging to snap to an interval
-hold shift and scroll to zoom
-hold alt and grab empty space to move slide the canvas view
-hold ctrl and grab empty space to zoom the canvas view
controls.drag mode: direction that elements can be dragged
controls.record: record connected values as they change

eventcanvas.description: schedule values to set over time

controls.input: input to use as x variable
controls.y=: expression to modify input. try something like "x+sin(x*pi*a)". available variables: a,b,c,d,e = the slider + sin(s below. t = time. x1,x2,y1,y2 = biquad state storage.

expression.description: shape modulation with a text-based mathematical expression

controls.limit: clip the feedback audio to this range, to avoid issues with feedback blowing out too intensely.

feedback.description: feed delayed audio back into earlier in the signal chain. use the "feedback out" connector for sending the audio back up the chain, and the primary output connector for sending the resulting audio forward. using feedback can often lead to extreme and difficult-to-control results!

controls.cut: how many bass partials to remove
controls.dry/wet: how much original input vs vocoded signal to output
controls.fric thresh: fricative detection sensitivity, to switch between using the carrier signal and white noise for vocoding
controls.phase off: how much we should offset the phase of the carrier signal's partials
controls.whisper: how much the carrier signal partial's phases should be randomized, which affects how whispery the output sound is

controls.harmratio: harmonic ratio of first-order modulator to input pitch
controls.harmratio2: harmonic ratio of second-order modulator to input pitch
controls.tweak: multiplier to harmonic ratio for first-order modulator
controls.tweak2: multiplier to harmonic ratio for second-order modulator

controls.two: sends note only every two beats

fouronthefloor.description: sends note 0 every beat, to trigger a kick drum

controls.damp: high frequency attenuation; a value of zero means all frequencies decay at the same rate, while higher settings will result in a faster decay of the high frequency range
controls.room size: controls the length of the reverb, a higher value means longer reverb

controls.dry/wet: how much of the effect to apply

freqdelay.description: delay effect with delay length based upon input notes

controls.mutate amount: amount to affect drawing by perlin noise field
controls.mutate noise: rate to move through perlin noise field
controls.quantize: should we quantize playback to a specified rhythmic interval?
controls.reseed: jump to a different location in the perlin noise field
controls.speed: speed up or slow down playback

fubble.description: draw on an X/Y pad and replay the drawing to modulate values. based on a concept proposed by olivia jack

controls.gain: amount to adjust signal. a value of 1 will cause no change to the signal.

controls.attack: speed at which gate blends open
controls.release: speed at which gate blends closed
controls.threshold: volume threshold to open up the gate

gate.description: only allow signal in when it's above a certain threshold. useful to eliminate line noise, or just as an effect.

controls.lissajous b: amount of blue in background lissajous curve
controls.lissajous g: amount of green in background lissajous curve
controls.lissajous r: amount of red in background lissajous curve

globalcontrols.description: interface controls, intended to allow you to use midi controllers to navigate the canvas. controlling these sliders directly with the mouse is not recommended.

controls.dry: amount of dry signal to allow through
controls.g oct: should we add octaves and fifths?
controls.len ms: length of each grain in milliseconds

controls.drag: the resistance force to apply opposite the velocity
controls.gravity: the gravitational force to apply downwards
controls.kick: click to apply kick force (or, pulse this module for the same result)
controls.kick amt: the amount of upward force to apply when kicking

gravity.description: make a modulation value rise and fall with physics

controls.grid: patch a grid in here, from a "midicontroller" module
controls.momentary: should clicks be treated as momentary inputs?

grid.description: generic grid, to be used by "script" module, to assist in writing scripts that use grid-based midi controllers

controls.arrangement: what style of layout should we use?
controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module
controls.latch: latch key presses, so you press once to play a note, and press again to release a note
controls.p.root: for chorder, make root note always play

gridkeyboard.description: grid-based keyboard, intended primarily for 64-pad grid controllers

gridnotedisplayer.description: use with a gridkeyboard to display currently playing notes, to visualize chords, arpeggiation, etc.

controls.direction: should the grid display the sliders vertically, or horizontally?
controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module

gridsliders.description: use a grid controller to control multiple sliders

groupcontrol.description: connect to several checkboxes, and control them all with one checkbox

controls.help page: which page of help information to show
controls.show tooltips: displays these tooltips. you can also toggle them with the F1 key, and you can turn these on or off by default in the "settings" menu.

controls.ch: which channel (or channels, if you want stereo) to use

input.description: get audio from input source, like a microphone

inverter.description: multiply a signal by -1. enables some pretty interesting effects when used with sends, to subtract out parts of signals when recombined.

controls.lite cpu: only recalculate some parameters once per buffer, to reduce CPU load. can make pitch bends and rapid modulation sound worse in some scenarios.
controls.pitchtone: adjust how pitch influences filter amount. a value of zero gives even filtering across the entire pitch range, higher values filter high pitches less, low values filter low pitches less.
controls.vel2env: how much velocity should affect excitation attack time
controls.vel2vol: how much velocity should affect voice volume
controls.x att: fade in time for excitation audio
controls.x dec: fade out time for excitation audio

karplusstrong.description: polyphonic plucked string physical modeling synth

keyboarddisplay.description: displays input notes on a keyboard, and allows you to click the keyboard to create notes

controls.attack: rise to the input level at this rate
controls.gain: multiply the input audio by this value
controls.release: decay from the input level at this rate

leveltocv.description: output a modulation value based on the level of incoming audio

controls.bias: bias the waveform towards the low or high point
controls.free rate: rate of oscillator running in non-clock-synced time
controls.high: output value at waveform's high point
controls.length: proportion of time that should be spent on the waveform cycle
controls.lite cpu: only recalculate some parameters once per buffer, to reduce CPU load. can sound worse in some scenarios, especially with rapid modulation.
controls.low: output value at waveform's low point
controls.offset: phase offset, to make oscillation earlier/later
controls.shuffle: adjust the waveoform to have a fast and slow cycle
controls.soften: smooth out the hard edges of square and saw waveforms
controls.spread: spread the waveform out to be closer to the low and high points

lfo.description: modulates a slider with a low-frequency oscillator

controls.decay: amount of time it takes for lit key to die off
controls.guitar lines: should we use the "guitar lines" light layout?
controls.octaves: when pressing a key, should we light that key for all octaves?

linnstrumentcontrol.description: [work in progress]control the lights of a linnstrument controller in various ways

lissajous.description: draw input audio as a lissajous curve. turn off "autocorrelation" in the module's triangle menu to use stereo channels to show stereo width.

controls.m: take the contents of this looper and merge it into another. click this button on the merge source, then on the merge target.
controls..5x: make loop play at half speed
controls.2x: make loop play at double speed
controls.auto: should pitch shift auto-adjust as the transport tempo adjusts?
controls.capture: when the next loop begins, record input for the duration of the loop
controls.commit: commit the current looperrecorder buffer to this loop
controls.copy: take the contents of this looper and copy it onto another. click this button on the copy source, then on the copy target.
controls.decay: amount to lower volume each loop
controls.fourtet: use a textural trick I saw four tet illustrate in a video once: slice the audio into chunks, and for each chunk it at double speed followed by playing it in reverse at double speed. this slider adjusts the mix between the original audio and this "fourtetified" audio.
controls.fourtetslices: chunk size to use for "fourtet" effect
controls.offset: amount to offset looper's playhead from transport position
controls.pitch: amount to pitch shift looper output
controls.resample for tempo: this button appears when the current global tempo no longer matches the tempo that the buffer was recorded at. click this to resample the buffer to match the new tempo.
controls.save: save this loop to a wav file
controls.scr: allow loop to be scratched by adjusting "scrspd"
controls.scrspd: playback speed, used with "scr" is enabled. modulate quickly for a vinyl-like scratching effect.
controls.set: shift the contents of the looper so the current offset is the start of the buffer
controls.swap: swap the contents of this looper and with another. click this button on two loopers to swap them.
controls.write: write input audio to loop buffer

looper.description: loop input audio. use with a "looperrecorder" for full functionality.

controls.len ms: length of each grain in milliseconds
controls.octaves: should we add octaves and fifths?
controls.on: use granular synthesis for looper playback

loopergranulator.description: use with a "looper" module to play the contents with granular synthesis

controls..5tempo: halve global transport tempo, while keeping connected loopers sounding the same
controls.1: capture the last measure to the currently-targeted looper
controls.2: capture the last 2 measures to the currently-targeted looper
controls.2xtempo: double global transport tempo, while keeping connected loopers sounding the same
controls.4: capture the last 4 measures to the currently-targeted looper
controls.8: capture the last 8 measures to the currently-targeted looper
controls.cancel free rec: if "free rec" is enabled, cancel recording without setting the loop length
controls.free rec: enable to start recording a loop with no predetermined length. disable to end recording, adjust global transport to match the loop length, and switch the recorder's mode to "loop"
controls.length: length in measures to use when connected loopers use the "commit" button
controls.mode: recorder mode: use "record" to record input and allow it to be committed to buffers when you're ready to loop, use "overdub" to record input and play the loop at our specified length, and use "loop" to play the current loop without adding input
controls.orig speed: reset looper to tempo that loops were recorded at
controls.resample: resample all connected loopers to new tempo
controls.resample & set key: snap tempo to nearest value that matches a key (based upon the current key and the tempo change), resample all connected loopers to that new tempo, and change global scale to the new key
controls.snap to pitch: snap tempo to nearest value that matches a key
controls.target: looper to commit audio to when using the on-buffer capture buttons to the left

looperrecorder.description: command center to manage recording into multiple loopers, and allow retroactive loop capture (i.e., always-on recording)

controls.go: rewrite the connected looper, and if that looper is connected to a send, set that send to output only to the right outlet
controls.new loop: start recording a dynamic loop length. press "go" when you want to rewrite it to the looper. this will also change bespoke's global tempo to match this new loop, so it's quite powerful and scary! click it again to cancel.

looperrewriter.description:
rewrites the contents of a looper with received input, to help you resample your own loops. attach the grey dot to a "looper" module.

the ideal way to use this module is to hook the "looper" directly up to a "send", hook the leftmost outlet of the "send" up to your effects processing (like an "effectchain"), hook the effect processing up to this "rewriter", and then also connect the rightmost outlet of the "send" up to this "rewriter"

loopstorer.description: [abandoned module, probably broken]store a looper's loops to swap them in and out

controls.gate*: behavior for each row: "repeat" plays every step, "once" plays just the first step, "hold" holds across all steps, "rest" plays no steps
controls.pitch*: pitch to use for this row
controls.pulses*: number of steps this row should last

m185sequencer.description: sequencer using the unique paradigm of the the m185 or intellijel metropolis

controls.end*: the output value at the top of the input's range
controls.input: the input value. intended to be a modulation patch target.
controls.start*: the output value at the bottom of the input's range

macroslider.description: take a value and send scaled versions of that value to multiple destinations

controls.value: outputs a CC value when this changes

midicc.description: outputs midi control change messages to route to a "midioutput" module

controls.bind (hold shift): when this is enabled, you can map a midi input to a UI control by hovering over a UI control, holding shift, and then using desired midi input
controls.blink: when the targeted control is enabled, send alternating on/off messages, to blink the associated LED
controls.channel: which channel to pay attention to
controls.control: pitch or control to refer to
controls.controltype:
how this control should modify the target.
 -slider: set the value interpolated between "midi off" and "midi on" to the slider's value
 -set: set the specified value directly when this button is pressed
 -release: set the specified value directly when this button is released
 -toggle: toggle the control's value to on/off when this button is pressed
 -direct: set the control to the literal midi input value
controls.feedback: which cc or note should we send the feedback to?
controls.increment: when "controltype" is "set" or "release", the targeted control is incremented by this amount (and the "value" field is ignored). when "controltype" is "slider", the targeted control is changed by this amount in the direction the control was changed (this setting is useful for "infinite encoders")
controls.layout: which layout file should we use for this controller? these can be created in your Documents/BespokeSynth/controllers folder.
controls.midi off: the lower end of the midi range. send this value when the targeted control is off. if "scale" is enabled, this also controls the lower end of the slider range, and you can set midi off to be higher than midi on to reverse a slider's direction.
controls.midi on: the upper end of the midi range. send this value when the targeted control is on. if "scale" is enabled, this also controls the upper end of the slider range, and you can set midi off to be higher than midi on to reverse a slider's direction.
controls.osc input port: port to use for osccontroller input
controls.page: select which page of midi controls to use. each page acts like an independent midi controller, so you can use pages to allow one midi controller to switch between controlling many things
controls.pageless: should this connection work across all pages of the midicontroller?
controls.path: path to the control that should be affected
controls.scale: should the output of this midi slider be scaled between "midi off" and "midi on"?
controls.twoway: should we send feedback to the controller? (to control the LEDs associated with the button/knob)

midicontroller.description: get midi input from external devices. to get a nice display in the "layout" view, create a .json file with the same name as your controller to describe your controller's layout, and place it in your "data/controllers" directory. look at the other files in that directory for examples.

midioutput.description: send midi to an external destination, such as hardware or other software

modulationvizualizer.description: display MPE modulation values for notes

modwheel.description: adds an expression value to a note

modwheeltocv.description: take a note's modwheel value and convert it to a modulation value

modwheeltopressure.description: swaps expression input to midi pressure in the output

modwheeltovibrato.description: convert note mod wheel input rhythmic pitch bend

mult.description: outputs the result of value 1 multiplier by value 2. value 1 and value 2 are intended to be patch targets for modulators.

controls.display length: length of buffer display, in seconds
controls.dry: how much dry signal to allow through
controls.feedback *: how much delayed audio from this tap should feed back in to the input

controls.bounce: write the tracks to your recordings directory
controls.clear: clear the audio in the tracks

multitrackrecorder.description: record several synchronized tracks of audio, to write to disk for mixing in an external DAW

multitrackrecordertrack.description: a track in a multitrack recorder

controls.pass: when true, the signal is allowed through

controls.width: how frequently a new noise sample should be chosen

noisify.description: multiply input signal by white noise

controls.canvas:
canvas of notes. canvas controls:
-shift-click to add a note
-hold shift and drag a note to duplicate
-hold alt to drag a note without snapping
-hold ctrl while dragging to snap to an interval
-hold shift and scroll to zoom
-hold alt and grab empty space to move slide the canvas view
-hold ctrl and grab empty space to zoom the canvas view
controls.drag mode: direction that elements can be dragged
controls.free rec: enable record mode, and extend canvas if we reach the end
controls.show chord intervals: show brackets to indicate chord relationships

controls.trigger: play note for this chain node

notechain.description: trigger a note, followed by a pulse to trigger another note after a delay

controls.chance: probability that a note is allowed

controls.div: measure division, when using "div" as the interval
controls.random: output random pitches within the range, rather than sequential
controls.start: pitch at the start of the sequence
controls.sync: if the output pitch should be synchronized to the global transport

notecounter.description: advance through pitches sequentially. useful for driving the "notesequencer" or "drumsequencer" modules.

controls.duration: note length when "trigger" button is used
controls.on: turn on to start note, turn off to end note
controls.trigger: press to trigger note for specified duration

controls.delay: amount of time to delay, in measures

notedelayer.description: delay input notes by a specified amount

controls.duration: length of the note in measures

noteduration.description: sets the length a note will play, ignoring the note-off message

notefilter.description: only allow a certain pitches through

noteflusher.description: send a note-off for all notes

controls.open: if notes are allowed to pass

notegate.description: allow or disallow notes to pass through

controls.weight *: chance that note goes to this destination

controls.time: amount of timing randomness, in milliseconds.

notehumanizer.description: add randomness to timing and velocity

notelatch.description: use note on messages to toggle notes on and off

controls.del/mute: if "write" is enabled, erase notes as the playhead passes over them. otherwise, just mute them.

notelooper.description: note loop recorder with overdubbing and replacement functionality

controls.octave: number of octaves to raise or lower

notepanalternator.description: sets a note's pan, alternating between two values, for the internal synths that support panned notes

notepanner.description: sets a note's pan, for the internal synths that support panned notes

notepanrandom.description: sets a note's pan to random values, for the internal synths that support panned notes

controls.wrap: instead of rejecting notes outside of this range, should we wrap them to the range instead?

noterangefilter.description: only allows notes through within a certain pitch range

controls.duration: total length of time repeats should last

noteratchet.description: rapidly repeat an input note over a duration

noterouter.description: allows you to control where notes are routed to using a UI control. to add destinations to the list, patch them as a target

controls.<: shift the sequence to the left
controls.>: shift the sequence to the right
controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module
controls.len: randomize the length of each step's note.
controls.length: length that the sequence below should play. the overall grid length can be changed by adjusting "gridsteps" in the triangle menu.
controls.loop reset: when sequence loops, reset to here instead. send a "downbeat"-style message from a pulser to restart the sequence from the first step.
controls.notemode: which set of pitches should the rows represent?
controls.octave: octave of the bottom pitch of this sequence
controls.pitch: randomize pitches in the sequence. hold shift to constrain the randomization to only pick roots and fifths.
controls.rand len chance: when clicking the random length button, what is the chance that a step gets changed?
controls.rand len range: when clicking the random length button, how much will the length change?
controls.rand pitch chance: when clicking the random pitch button, what is the chance that a step gets changed?
controls.rand pitch range: when clicking the random pitch button, how far will the pitch change?
controls.rand vel chance: when clicking the random velocity button, what is the chance that a step gets changed?
controls.rand vel density: when clicking the random velocity button, what are the chances that a step should have a note?
controls.vel: randomize the velocity of each step's note.
controls.x offset: x offset of attached grid controller
controls.y offset: y offset of attached grid controller

notesequencer.description: looping sequence of notes at an interval. pair with a "pulser" module for more interesting step control. hold "shift" to adjust step length.

controls.oct: octave to adjust output pitch by

notesinger.description: output a note based on a detected pitch

controls.pitch *: pitch to use for this outlet

notesorter.description: separate notes by pitch. any unmapped pitches go through the standard outlet.

notestepper.description: output notes through a round robin of patch cables, to create sequential variety

notestream.description: view a stream of notes as they're played

controls.strum: move the slider past each note to strum it

notestrummer.description: send a chord into this, and move a slider to strum each note of the chord

notetofreq.description: takes an input note, and outputs that note's frequency in hertz

notetoms.description: takes an input note, and outputs the period of that note's frequency in milliseconds. useful for setting delay lines to create specific pitches.

notetopulse.description: trigger a pulse whenever a note is received

controls.range: number of semitones before wrapping back down to min pitch

notewrap.description: wrap an input pitch to stay within a desired range

controls.detune: when unison is 1, detunes oscillator by this amount. when unison is 2, one oscillator is tuned normally and the other is detuned by this amount. when unison is >2, oscillators are randomly detuned within this range.
controls.fmax: frequency cutoff of lowpass filter at the max of the envelope. set this slider to the max to disable the filter
controls.fmin: frequency cutoff of lowpass filter at the min of the envelope
controls.lite cpu: only recalculate some parameters once per buffer, to reduce CPU load. can make pitch bends and rapid modulation sound worse in some scenarios.
controls.phase: phase offset of oscillator, and phase offset between unison voices. useful to patch into with a very fast modulator, to achieve phase modulation.
controls.pw: pulse width (or shape for non-square waves)
controls.shuffle: stretches and squeezes every other cycle of the waveform
controls.soften: soften edges of square and saw waveforms
controls.sync: turns on "sync" mode, to reset the phase at syncf's frequency
controls.syncf: frequency to reset the phase, when "sync" is enabled
controls.unison: how many oscillators to play for one note
controls.vel2env: how much should the input velocity affect the speed of the volume and filter envelopes?
controls.vel2vol: how much should the input velocity affect the output volume?
controls.width: controls how voices are panned with unison is greater than 1

oscillator.description: polyphonic enveloped oscillator. modulations (with MPE support): modwheel closes filter further (if filter is enabled), pressure decreases detune amount

controls.label*: label to send slider value. the message will be sent in the format /bespoke/[label] [value]
controls.note out address: label to send input notes. the message will be sent in the format /bespoke/[label] [pitch] [velocity]
controls.osc out address: destination to send OSC messages to
controls.osc out port: port to send OSC messages to
controls.slider*: sends a value to the address. try patching a modulator into this, such as a leveltocv module to send audio levels.

oscoutput.description: send OSC messages when slider values change or when notes are received

controls.ch: channel (or channels, if you want stereo) to send audio to

output.description: route audio in here to send it to an output channel (your speakers or audio interface)

controls.pan: amount to send signal to the left and right channels. a value of .5 is centered.
controls.widen: delay a channel by this many samples. results in a pan-like effect where the sound seems to come from from a direction.

panner.description: pan audio left and right. also, converts a mono input to a stereo output.

controls.passthrough: should the original audio pass through?

pitchchorus.description: output pitch-shifted version of input audio, based on input midi notes. pitch 60 is the reference pitch used.

controls.time: time in milliseconds to ramp from pitch offset into input pitch

pitchdive.description: use pitchbend to settle into an input pitch from a starting offset

controls.left: pitch that represents full left pan
controls.right: pitch that represents full right pan

pitchpanner.description: add pan modulation to notes based upon input pitch, so low pitches are panned in one direction and high pitches are panned in another

pitchremap.description: remap input pitches to different output pitches

pitchsetter.description: set an incoming note to use a specified pitch

controls.ratio: amount to pitchshift by (a value of 1 indicates no shift)

pitchtocv.description: take a note's pitch and convert it to a modulation value

controls.ref freq: the output is the input frequency divided by this number

pitchtospeed.description: convert an input pitch to a speed ratio. you could use this to control a sample's playback speed and make it playable with a keyboard.

controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module
controls.link columns: if the mute/delete control should be shared across the entire column
controls.load*: load the sequence stored in this slot
controls.mute/delete*: if write is disabled, mute this row. if write is enabled, clear the steps as the playhead passes them
controls.note repeat: if held notes should repeat every step
controls.store*: store the current sequence to this slot
controls.write: if the current input should be written to the sequence. this will also delete steps if mute/delete is enabled for this row

playsequencer.description: drum sequencer that allows you to punch in to record and overdub steps, inspired by the pulsar-23 drum machine

controls.length*: number of steps for this line
controls.note*: pitch to use for this line

polyrhythms.description: looping sequence with lines on different divisions

controls.require held: if enabled, only glide to a new note if an old note is held. otherwise, always glide, based upon the prior input note.

portamento.description: only allows one note to play at a time, and uses pitch bend to glide between notes

controls.disband: free all modules from this prefab

prefab.description: create a collection of modules that can be loaded from the "prefabs" menu. drag and drop modules onto here to add them to the prefab. drag the grey cable to any modules you want to remove from the prefab.

controls.blend ms: time to blend preset values over

presets.description: save and restore sets of values. connect the grey circle to modules to affect all controls on that module. connect the purple circle to a control to affect only that control. shift-click on the grid to store a preset to that square, and click on a grid square to load that preset.

pressuretocv.description: take a note's pressure and convert it to a modulation value

pressuretomodwheel.description: takes midi pressure modulation input and changes it to modwheel modulation

pressuretovibrato.description: takes midi pressure modulation input and changes it to vibrato, using pitch bend

previousnote.description: when receiving a note on, output the prior note on that we received

pulsebutton.description: trigger a pulse with a button press

controls.chance: chance that pulses are allowed through

pulsechance.description: randomly allow pulses through, based on chance

controls.delay: time to delay, in fractions of a measure

pulsegate.description: control if pulses are allowed through

controls.weight *: chance that pulse goes to this destination

controls.div: measure division, when using "div" as the interval
controls.offset: pulse time offset, in fractions of a measure
controls.random: tell pulsed modules to randomize their position
controls.reset: length of sequence before sending reset pulse
controls.timemode: when to send downbeat pulses, or set to "free" for pulses not locked to the transport

pulser.description: send pulse messages at an interval

controls.interval: length of each step within the sequence

pulsesequence.description: defines a looping sequence of pulses

controls.interval: length of each step within the sequence

pulsetrain.description: defines a list of pulses to execute, once pulsed

pumper.description: dip the volume of a signal rhythmically, to emulate a "pumping sidechain" effect

push2control.description: use an ableton push 2 to control bespoke's interface

controls.repeat: when holding a note, should we repeat it every interval?

quantizer.description: delay inputs until the next quantization interval

controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module

radiosequencer.description: sequence to only enable one value at a time. patch it to the "enabled" checkbox on several modules to only enable one module at a time. works well in conjunction with "groupcontrol" module.

controls.length: length of time to blend over
controls.start: begin blending (or, send a pulse to this module for the same result)
controls.target: the value to arrive at when the ramp is over

ramper.description: blend a control to a specified value over a specified time

controls.offset: the amount of time to offset playback within the interval
controls.probability: the chance that a note will play each interval
controls.skip: after a note plays, don't play a note the next n-1 times that it would have played

randomnote.description: play a note at a given interval with a random chance

controls.dry/wet: how much of the original audio to use vs modulated audio
controls.freq: frequency to use. can also be set by patching a note input into this module.
controls.glide: how long an input note should take to glide to the desired frequency

ringmodulator.description: modulate a signal's amplitude at a frequency

samplebrowser.description: browse your system for samples. drag samples from here to your desired targets (sampleplayer, drumplayer, seaofgrain, etc)

controls.canvas:
canvas of samples. drag and drop samples onto here. canvas controls:
-hold shift and drag a sample to duplicate
-hold alt to drag a sample without snapping
-hold ctrl while dragging to snap to an interval
-hold shift and scroll to zoom
-hold alt and grab empty space to move slide the canvas view
-hold ctrl and grab empty space to zoom the canvas view
controls.drag mode: direction that elements can be dragged

controls.save: save this clip to a file

samplecapturer.description: [work in progress]record audio to short clips. recording starts when audio passes a threshold.

controls.append to rec: when recording, append to the previous recording, rather than clearing the sample first
controls.attack: speed at which gate blends open
controls.click sets cue: when true, clicking on the waveform will set the start position of the current cue
controls.cue len: length in seconds of the current cue. a value of zero will play to the end of the sample.
controls.cue speed: playback speed of the current cue
controls.cue start: start point in seconds of the current cue
controls.cuepoint: sets the current cue to edit
controls.grabhovered: grab a sample of this cue to drop onto another module
controls.load: show a file chooser to load a sample
controls.loop: wrap playhead to beginning when it reaches end
controls.pause: pause playing and leave playhead where it is
controls.play: start playing from the current playhead
controls.record: record audio input into our sample buffer. clears the current sample.
controls.record as clips: when recording, only record when there is enough input to open the gate, and mark up each recorded segment with cue points
controls.release: speed at which gate blends closed
controls.save: save this sample to a file
controls.searchresult*: click to download this youtube search result. downloading long videos may take a while.
controls.select played: when true, any cue point played via incoming notes will become the current cue
controls.show grid: show a quarter note grid (when zoomed in far enough)
controls.threshold: volume threshold to open up the gate for recording
controls.trim: discard all audio outside the current zoom range
controls.youtube: download the audio of the youtube URL currently on your clipboard

sampleplayer.description: sample playback with triggerable cue points, clip extraction, and youtube search/download functionality. resize this module larger to access additional features. if you have a youtube URL in your clipboard, a button will appear to allow you to download the audio.

controls.passthrough: should input audio pass through as we're recording?
controls.pitch: should we attempt pitch-correct the audio?
controls.rec: enable to clear the current recording, and record new audio once the input threshold is reached
controls.thresh: when recording is enabled, exceed this threshold with input audio to begin recording

sampler.description: very basic polyphonic pitched sample player and recorder. send audio in, and use note input to play the recorded audio.

controls.clear: when enabled, clears any pressed grid squares
controls.duplicate: what enabled, duplicates last pressed sample onto any pressed grid squares
controls.edit: enable controls to adjust recorded sample for last pressed grid square
controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module
controls.passthrough: should the incoming audio pass through to the output?

samplergrid.description: record input onto pads, and play back the pads. intended to be used with an 64-pad grid controller.

controls.intonation: which method to use to tune the scale
controls.note: the pitch that maps to the frequency defined in "tuning"
controls.scale: which set of notes to use
controls.tet: how many semitones make up an octave
controls.tuning: what frequency does the pitch defined in "note" represent?

scale.description: controls the global scale used by various modules

controls.retrigger: immediately replay current notes when changing the transpose amount

scaledegree.description: transpose input based on current scale

controls.reset: reset the input collection of notes

scaledetect.description: detect which scales fit a collection of entered notes. the last played pitch is used as the root.

controls.a: variable for the script to use, can be modulation by other sources
controls.b: variable for the script to use, can be modulation by other sources
controls.c: variable for the script to use, can be modulation by other sources
controls.code: write code here. press ctrl-R to execute the code, or ctrl-shift-R to just execute the current block.
controls.d: variable for the script to use, can be modulation by other sources
controls.loadscript: choose a script from here, then press "load"
controls.run: click here to execute the code, or press ctrl-R
controls.stop: cancel any events scheduled by this script

script.description: python scripting for livecoding notes and module control

scriptstatus.description: shows everything in the current python scope, for debugging

controls.keyboard base pitch: midi pitch that represents the start of the sample
controls.keyboard num pitches: amount of pitches to assign across the sample
controls.len ms *: length of each grain in milliseconds
controls.octaves *: should we add octaves and fifths?
controls.offset: where to start view of the sample
controls.pos *: position of this voice within the sample
controls.record: record input as the granular buffer, to use seaofgrain a live granular delay

seaofgrain.description: granular synth, playable with sliders or MPE input

controls.selector: which value should be set to 1

selector.description: radio button control to only enable one value at a time. patch it to the "enabled" checkbox on several modules to only enable one module at a time. works well in conjunction with "groupcontrol" module.

controls.amount: amount to send out the right-side cable
controls.crossfade: when true, output of the left-side cable is reduced as "amount" increases

send.description: duplicate a signal and send it to a second destination

signalclamp.description: clamps an audio signal's value within a range

controls.detune: amount to detune from specified frequency
controls.freq mode: what mode should we use for input notes? "instant" changes to the input note's frequency instantly, "ramp" ramps to the frequency over time, and "slider" allows you to use a slider to interpolate between the last two input notes
controls.pw: pulse width (or shape for non-square waves)
controls.ramp: amount of time to ramp to input frequency
controls.shuffle: stretches and squeezes every other cycle of the waveform
controls.slider: slider to interpolate between last two input pitches
controls.soften: soften edges of square and saw waveforms
controls.sync: turns on "sync" mode, to reset the phase at syncf's frequency
controls.syncf: frequency to reset the phase, when "sync" is enabled

slidersequencer.description: trigger notes along a continuous timeline

controls.input: set a value to smooth, patch a modulator into here

smoother.description: outputs a smoothed value of the input

splitter.description: splits a stereo signal into two mono signals, or duplicates a mono signal

controls.dotted eighth: stutter on a dotted eighth interval
controls.double speed: stutter at double speed, high pitched
controls.free: stutter with the settings specified by the following sliders
controls.free length: length in seconds for "free" stutter mode
controls.grid: patch a grid in here from a "midicontroller" module
controls.half speed: stutter at half speed, low pitched
controls.ramp in: stutter with speed climbing up from zero to one
controls.ramp out: stutter with speed quickly falling to zero

subtract.description: outputs the result of value 2 subtracted from value 1. value 1 and value 2 are intended to be patch targets for modulators.

controls.sustain: should we hold the input notes?

timelinecontrol.description: [abandoned module, possibly broken] global timeline control to position transport

timerdisplay.description: displays a timer to indicate how long a patch has been running

controls.autosave: every time a new module is added, trigger a save to data/savestate/autosave/, to help reload state in the event of a crash. can be quite slow if using modules with large samples.
controls.load: load a saved .bsk file to restore state
controls.lookahead (exp.): use lookahead scheduling, which is necessary for scriptmodule. gets automatically turned on when you use scriptmodule. so far, lookahead scheduling seems to not create any issues, but leaving this checkbox here just in case.
controls.reset layout: reset to the layout specified in "layout" in userprefs.json
controls.save: save current state as .bsk file, to be restored later
controls.save as: save current state as a new .bsk file
controls.write audio: write the last 30 minutes of audio to your specified recordings_path

controls.swing: where the halfway point of musical time within the swing interval should fall. a value of .5 represents no swing.
controls.swing interval: interval over which to apply swing
controls.tempo: global tempo, in beats per minute

transport.description: controls tempo and current time position

controls.retrigger: immediately replay current notes when changing the transpose root or the scale

transposefrom.description: transpose input from a specified root to the root of the current scale. the primary usage of this would be to allow you to play a keyboard in C, but it gets transposed to the current scale.

unstablemodwheel.description: mutate MPE slide with perlin noise

unstablepitch.description: mutate MPE pitchbend with perlin noise

unstablepressure.description: mutate MPE pressure with perlin noise

controls.set: click here to send the value (or, send a pulse to this module for the same result)

valuesetter.description: set a specified value on a targeted control

valuestream.description: displays a control's value over time

velocityscaler.description: scale a note's velocity to be higher or lower

controls.rand: randomness to reduce output velocity by

velocitysetter.description: set a note's velocity to this value

controls.downbeat: should we reset the sequence every downbeat?

velocitystepsequencer.description: adjusts the velocity of incoming notes based upon a sequence

velocitytocv.description: take a note's velocity and convert it to a modulation value

controls.vibrato: amount of pitch bend to add

vibrato.description: add rhythmic oscillating pitch bend to notes

controls.control: enable/disable transport control. when you enable it, it will use the current speed as the reference speed (so, the output will output a value of 1 until you change the vinyl's speed)

vinylcontrol.description: modulator which outputs a speed value based upon control vinyl input audio. provide it with a stereo signal from control vinyl (like you'd use to control serato) patched in from an "input" module.

controls.bands: how many frequency bands to use
controls.max band: volume limit for each frequency band
controls.mix: how much original input vs vocoded signal to output
controls.ring: how long it should take the bands to "cool down"
controls.spacing: how frequency bands should be spaced

vocoder.description: frequency band-based vocoder. this must be paired with a "vocodercarrier" module. voice should be routed into this module, and a synth should be patched into the vocodercarrier.

vocodercarrier.description: connect to "vocoder" or "fftvocoder" modules. send the synth audio into this module, and the voice audio into the vocoder module.

volcabeatscontrol.description: outputs MIDI data to control various aspects of the KORG volca beats drum machine

controls.program change: send a program change message to the VST instance
controls.save as: save the current VST settings as a preset to load again later
controls.show parameter: select parameters to display them, so they can be adjusted from within bespoke's interface. if a VST has more than 20 parameters, this list will initially be empty. in that case, to make a parameter appear in this list, wiggle it within the VST's interface.

controls.freq: frequency to sync display to. gets automatically set if you patch a note input into this module

controls.rescale: rescales input before feeding it into expression
controls.y=: waveshaping expression. try something like "x+sin(x*pi*a)". available variables: a,b,c,d,e = the slider + sin(s below. t = time. x1,x2,y1,y2 = biquad state storage.

whitekeys.description: remap the white keys that correspond to the C major scale to instead play the current global scale
